com.restfb.util
Class InsightUtils

java.lang.Object
  com.restfb.util.InsightUtils

public class InsightUtils
extends Object

Utility methods to ease querying Insight Metrics over a set of dates.

Since:
1.6.10
Author:
Andrew Liles

Method Detail

executeInsightQueriesByMetricByDate

public static SortedMap<String,SortedMap<Date,Object>> executeInsightQueriesByMetricByDate(FacebookClient facebookClient,
                                                                                           String pageObjectId,
                                                                                           Set<String> metrics,
                                                                                           InsightUtils.Period period,
                                                                                           Set<Date> periodEndDates)
Queries Facebook via FQL for several Insights at different date points.

The output groups the result by metric and then by date, matching the input arguments. Map entries may be null if Facebook does not return corresponding data, e.g. when you query a metric which is not available at the chosen period. The inner Map's Object value may be a strongly typed value for some metrics, but in other cases Facebook returns a JsonObject.

Sample output, assuming 2 metrics were queried for 5 dates: 

 {page_active_users = {
     2011-jan-01 = 7,
     2011-jan-02 = 26,
     2011-jan-03 = 15,
     2011-jan-04 = 10,
     2011-jan-05= 687},
 page_tab_views_login_top_unique = {
     2011-jan-01 = {"photos":2,"app_4949752878":3,"wall":30},
     2011-jan-02 = {"app_4949752878":1,"photos":1,"app_2373072738":2,"wall":23},
     2011-jan-03 = {"app_4949752878":1,"wall":12},
     2011-jan-04 = {"photos":1,"wall":11},
     2011-jan-05 = {"app_494975287":2,"app_237307273":2,"photos":6,"wall":35,"info":6}}

Parameters:
facebookClient - The FacebookClient used to communicate with the Insights API.
pageObjectId - The required object_id to query.
metrics - A not null/empty set of metrics that will be queried for the given period.
period - The required time period over which to query.
periodEndDates - A non-null, non-empty Set in which each date should be normalized to be midnight in the PST timezone; see convertToMidnightInPacificTimeZone(Set).
Returns:
A Map of Maps: the outer keys will be all the metrics requested that were available at the period/times requested. The inner keys will be the Set of periodEndDates.
See Also:
convertToMidnightInPacificTimeZone(Set), executeInsightQueriesByDate(FacebookClient, String, Set, Period, Set)

executeInsightQueriesByDate

public static SortedMap<Date,JsonArray> executeInsightQueriesByDate(FacebookClient facebookClient,
                                                                    String pageObjectId,
                                                                    Set<String> metrics,
                                                                    InsightUtils.Period period,
                                                                    Set<Date> periodEndDates)
Queries Facebook via FQL for several Insights at different date points and returns "raw" results.

A variation on executeInsightQueriesByMetricByDate(FacebookClient, String, Set, Period, Set) , this method returns the raw output from the Facebook, keying the output by date alone. The JsonArray value will contain the metrics that were requested and available at the date.

Sample output, assuming 2 metrics were queried for 5 dates: 

 {2011-jan-01 = [
     {"metric":"page_active_users","value":7},
     {"metric":"page_tab_views_login_top_unique","value":{"photos":2,"app_4949752878":3,"wall":30}}], 
 2011-jan-02 = [
     {"metric":"page_active_users","value":26},
     {"metric":"page_tab_views_login_top_unique","value":{"app_4949752878":1,"photos":1,"app_2373072738":2,"wall":23}}], 
 2011-jan-03 = [
     {"metric":"page_active_users","value":15},
     {"metric":"page_tab_views_login_top_unique","value":{"app_4949752878":1,"wall":12}}], 
 2011-jan-04 = [
     {"metric":"page_active_users","value":10},
     {"metric":"page_tab_views_login_top_unique","value":{"photos":1,"wall":11}}]
 2011-jan-05 = [
     {"metric":"page_active_users","value":687},
     {"metric":"page_tab_views_login_top_unique","value":{"app_494975287":2,"app_237307273":2,"photos":6,"wall":35,"info":6}}]
 }

Parameters:
facebookClient - The FacebookClient used to communicate with the Insights API.
pageObjectId - The required object_id to query.
metrics - A not null/empty set of metrics that will be queried for the given period.
period - The required time period over which to query.
periodEndDates - A non-null, non-empty Set in which each date should be normalized to be midnight in the PST timezone; see convertToMidnightInPacificTimeZone(Set).
Returns:
Insights query results, grouped by date.
See Also:
convertToMidnightInPacificTimeZone(Set), executeInsightQueriesByMetricByDate(FacebookClient, String, Set, Period, Set)

convertToMidnightInPacificTimeZone

public static Date convertToMidnightInPacificTimeZone(Date date)
Slides this date back to midnight in the PST timezone fit for the Facebook Query Language.

More details are available at http://developers.facebook.com/docs/reference/fql/insights.

Parameters:
date - The date to slide back.
Returns:
A midnight-PST version of the provided date.
See Also:
convertToMidnightInPacificTimeZone(Set)

convertToMidnightInPacificTimeZone

public static SortedSet<Date> convertToMidnightInPacificTimeZone(Set<Date> dates)
Slides these dates back to midnight in the PST timezone fit for the Facebook Query Language.

More details are available at http://developers.facebook.com/docs/reference/fql/insights.

Parameters:
dates - The dates to slide back.
Returns:
Midnight-PST versions of the provided dates.
See Also:
convertToMidnightInPacificTimeZone(Date)
